resources.string: Please verify that your internet connection works before downloading.
Failed to unzip the server files
Please stop the server before updating the binary
Something went wrong: Couldn\'t delete file
Cuberite failed to start. Ensure that your binary has the following ABI: %1$s
No filemanager found: Please install one
This service runs Cuberite and ensures that it is not killed by the system.
This service downloads, unzips and installs Cuberite.

SHA-1 sums don\'t match. This may indicate an attempt to spoof you, or just a download error. Please try downloading Cuberite again, and if the error persists, you may bypass the check by installing Cuberite via the settings.
Stores server files on your SD card. Files are not transferred between internal and SD storage.
Please stop the server before changing the storage location

The server from which Cuberite will download from. If you are running your own (automated) builds, you can change this setting and Cuberite will use your own server. Please note, that in order to have working automatic updates, the server needs to provide valid SHA-1 files.
Use this section from time to time to update your installation of Cuberite. Please note that if you perform a server.zip update this may overwrite custom server settings.
Instead of downloading Cuberite you can choose to use your own compiled binaries. Use this only if you understand what you are doing.
Select and install binary zip file

Normally, Cuberite verifies the downloaded executables to make sure Cuberite was downloaded correctly. Use this button if the verification fails, but please note that you are disabling a security feature by that.
For fine-tuning your server, you are entitled to use the built-in Webadmin. Use the settings here to set a username and password for it
Before setting the Webadmin credentials, Cuberite needs to be installed before. You can either choose to install it now or just close this dialog
Cuberite needs to be running before you can access the Webadmin
Something went wrong while accessing the Webadmin configuration
Success! The new credentials are activated when you start Cuberite the next time
If you have troubles connecting to Cuberite and get the message \"Failed to authenticate!\", you might want to disable authentication.
Something went wrong while accessing the Server configuration
Success! Authentication is now %1$s! Restart the server to activate the change
This app uses third-party libraries to provide certain features. Below is some info about these libraries as well as their respective licenses
